1.desc: Your fleet has 15% increased Firepower and Torpedo, and 10% reduced Evasion.
1.name: Single Line Assault

2.desc: Your fleet Evasion has increased by 30%, while Firepower and Torpedo has reduced by 5%.
2.name: Double Line Advance

4.desc: Restore 10%  HP to all ships in your current fleet
4.name: Emergency Repair

10.desc: Submarine Support can be called in beyond the fleet's ASR boundaries.
10.name: Unrestricted Support

11.desc: Changes the Submarine Fleet's position on the map.
11.name: Positional Change

12.desc: Requisition land-based anti-submarine support. Perform an anti-submarine scan of the entire map, marking any submerged submarines.
12.name: Sonar Scan

13.desc: You currently have flares. The fleet that retrieved them will be able to fire flares during the next $1 battle(s).
13.name: Flare Shell

14.desc: You are in control of a lighthouse. Your fleets may receive searchlight support during combat.
14.name: Lighthouse

16.desc: The turbulent sea at night obscures your visibility. Both your vanguard fleet and the enemies will have Concealment Zones, making it harder to land hits.
16.name: Poor Visibility

17.desc: Thick fog blankets the battlefield, reducing the rate at which Concealment Zones shrink for both your fleets and enemies.
17.name: Dense Fog

18.desc: Lets you launch a missile strike on the map.
18.name: Missile

47.desc:
Increases the Oil spent on this current stage by 100%;
In the process, increases the Commander EXP, Meowfficer EXP, and Ship EXP gained by 100%, and grants an additional drop chance. Mood consumption and Affection gain are both increased by 100%.
47.name: High-Efficiency Operation

90.desc: Kizuna AI is going to harass you during your next battle: Submarine Call, Air Strike, Torpedo Attack, and Main Battery Fire functions will be locked (including manual control mode). Tap her face a bunch to make her go away.
90.name: RED ALERT!

91.desc: Crisis Averted~Nobody is going to harass you this time
91.name: Crisis Averted~

92.desc: Enemies will appear on Ambush tiles during nighttime.
92.name: Nightfall

93.desc: Enemies won't appear on Ambush tiles during daytime.
93.name: Daybreak

94.desc: The enemy is currently providing air support on this battlefield. Enemy airstrikes will appear during battle.
94.name: Enemy Air Support

95.desc: Allies are ready to provide your fleet with air support. Allied airstrikes will appear during battle.
95.name: Ally Air Support

96.desc: The enemy's flagship fleet has captured critical information about your fleet. During the next battle with the boss, your fleet will deal 30% less damage and take 30% more damage.
96.name: Data Analyzed

97.desc: The enemy's flagship fleet has captured critical information about your fleet. During the next battle with the boss, your fleet will deal 30% less damage and take 30% more damage.
97.name: Data Analyzed

1000.desc: Launches 1 airstrike against the enemy fleet.
1000.name: Airstrike

1001.desc: Move an enemy fleet to an empty tile next to it.
1001.name: Tactical Isolation

8732.desc: When activated: Shinano fires 3 rounds of supporting fire and increases your fleet's FP, TRP, and AVI by 5.0%.
8732.name: Blessing of the Butterfly

8744.desc: When activated: Shinano fires 3 rounds of supporting fire and increases your fleet's FP, TRP, and AVI by 5.0%.
8744.name: Blessing of the Butterfly

8745.desc: When activated: Shinano fires 3 rounds of supporting fire and increases your fleet's FP, TRP, and AVI by 5.0%.
8745.name: Blessing of the Butterfly

8746.desc: When activated: Shinano fires 3 rounds of supporting fire and increases your fleet's FP, TRP, and AVI by 5.0%.
8746.name: Blessing of the Butterfly

8801.desc: You've lost control of the Floating Fortress! During battle, enemy forces will be reinforced by additional aircraft!
8801.name: Control Lost

8802.desc: You've secured the Floating Fortress! During battle, allied aircraft will arrive to attack the enemies!
8802.name: Secured Control

8832.desc: Allies provide 1 wave of artillery support, dealing continuous DMG to the enemy for a period of time (DMG increases the longer the META Showdown boss has been active).
8832.name: Artillery Support

8841.desc: In battle, your fleet will receive bombardment support.
8841.name: Radiance

8842.desc: The light has faded, and a mysterious foe appears in the enemy's fleet.
8842.name: Afterglow

8858.desc: Your fleet will receive bombardment support, but a mysterious foe also appears in the enemy's fleet.
8858.name: Confluence of Dawn

8863.desc:
A mysterious Siren labyrinth that spans the area.
Every time your fleets move a total of 3 times, the labyrinth will shift.
8863.name: Labyrinth

8864.desc: The Sirens have activated a strong jamming device. During battle, your fleet will be attacked with special barrages with a jamming effect.
8864.name: Song of the Sirens

8865.desc: Currently receiving support from Aquila. Support airstrikes will appear in battle.
8865.name: Aerial Support

8867.desc: Currently receiving support from Aquila. Support airstrikes will appear in battle.
8867.name: Aerial Support

8869.desc: Currently receiving support from Aquila. Support airstrikes will appear in battle.
8869.name: Aerial Support

8874.desc: Your Sakura Empire ships deal 5.0% more DMG, but also take 5.0% more DMG. Your Eagle Union ships deal 5.0% less DMG, but also take 5.0% less DMG.
8874.name: Reenactment Modulation System

8877.desc: The battlefield is obscured by a Siren-created haze. The Accuracy of allied fleets is decreased by 5%, and enemy fleet compositions cannot be seen.
8877.name: Siren Sea Fog

8880.desc: You're being supported by an unknown ally. During combat, the enemy will be bombarded by a supporting barrage.
8880.name: Mirror Hacking

8882.desc: You're being supported by an unknown ally. During combat, the enemy will be bombarded by a supporting barrage.
8882.name: Mirror Hacking

8884.desc: You're being supported by an unknown ally. During combat, the enemy will be bombarded by a supporting barrage.
8884.name: Mirror Hacking

8909.desc: All Sirens in the area will reposition to engage your fleets.
8909.name: Search and Destroy Protocol

8910.desc:
The entire map is within range of missile attacks. Fleets standing on tiles targeted by missiles will take damage upon impact.
Turns until impact: 3
8910.name: Missile Strike Area

8911.desc:
The entire map is within range of missile attacks. Fleets standing on tiles targeted by missiles will take damage upon impact.
Turns until impact: 2
8911.name: Missile Strike Area

8912.desc:
The entire map is within range of missile attacks. Fleets standing on tiles targeted by missiles will take damage upon impact.
Turns until impact: 1
8912.name: Missile Strike Area

8913.desc: A Siren weather control device is generating a hazardous zone that expands every time your fleets move. Proceed with caution.
8913.name: Ground Zero Protocol

8914.desc:
The entire map is within range of missile attacks. Fleets standing on tiles targeted by missiles will take damage upon impact.
Turns until impact: 3
8914.name: Missile Strike Area

8915.desc:
The entire map is within range of missile attacks. Fleets standing on tiles targeted by missiles will take damage upon impact.
Turns until impact: 2
8915.name: Missile Strike Area

8916.desc:
The entire map is within range of missile attacks. Fleets standing on tiles targeted by missiles will take damage upon impact.
Turns until impact: 1
8916.name: Missile Strike Area

8917.desc: Ice constructs in the area block the way forward. Destroy the enemy fleets defending them to proceed.
8917.name: Ice Construct

8918.desc:
The synchronization process is causing hallucinations. 
Barrages will spawn during battle which inflict damage to both friends and foes alike.
8918.name: Data Synchronization I

8919.desc:
The synchronization process is causing hallucinations. 
Barrages will spawn during battle which inflict damage to both friends and foes alike.
8919.name: Data Synchronization II

8920.desc:
The synchronization process is causing hallucinations. 
Barrages will spawn during battle which inflict damage to both friends and foes alike.
8920.name: Data Synchronization III

8941.desc: The Iron Blood's jamming prevents you from determining the size and type of the enemy's fleets on the tactical map.
8941.name: Iron Blood Jamming

8942.desc: The Singularity is having strange effects on the battlefield. Your ships deal 20% increased Main Gun DMG, your ships deal 20% decreased Airstrike DMG, and your BBs' Main Gun Spread is increased by 5.
8942.name: Singularity Fluctuations

8943.desc: The Sirens' jamming is having strange effects on the battlefield.
8943.name: Siren Jamming

8944.desc: Your fleet continuously takes Burn DMG during battle.
8944.name: Siren Jamming - Volatile Ether

8945.desc: Your fleet's SPD is greatly decreased.
8945.name: Siren Jamming - Slowing Waves

8946.desc: Your fleet will experience periodic bursts of electromagnetic interference during battle.
8946.name: Siren Jamming - Chaotic Frequency

8953.desc: You have the Iron Blood fleet's support. They negate the effects of all hostile jamming and assist you with supporting barrages during battle.
8953.name: Iron Blood Support

8955.desc: You have the Iron Blood fleet's support. They negate the effects of all hostile jamming and assist you with supporting barrages during battle.
8955.name: Iron Blood Support

8957.desc: You have the Iron Blood fleet's support. They negate the effects of all hostile jamming and assist you with supporting barrages during battle.
8957.name: Iron Blood Support

8959.desc: You have the Iron Blood fleet's support. They negate the effects of all hostile jamming and assist you with supporting barrages during battle.
8959.name: Iron Blood Support

8974.desc: The Singularity is having strange effects on the battlefield. Your ships deal 20% increased cannon DMG, but they also deal 20% decreased Airstrike DMG and your BBs' Main Gun Spread is increased by 5.
8974.name: Singularity Fluctuations - Type A

8975.desc: The Singularity is having strange effects on the battlefield. Your ships deal 20% increased Airstrike DMG, but they also deal 20% decreased cannon DMG.
8975.name: Singularity Fluctuations - Type B

8976.desc:
Visions of unknown origin are appearing on the battlefield. 
Barrages will fire during battle which harm anything in their path, friend or foe.
8976.name: Synchronization Visions - I

9211.desc: The Dragon Palace grants the enemy supporting fire in battle.
9211.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - White Waves

9212.desc: The Dragon Palace grants your fleet supporting fire in battle.
9212.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - White Waves

9231.desc: The Dragon Palace grants the enemy supporting fire in battle.
9231.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - Scarlet Flames

9232.desc: The Dragon Palace grants your fleet supporting fire in battle.
9232.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - Scarlet Flames

9251.desc: The Dragon Palace grants the enemy supporting fire in battle as well as protective shields.
9251.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - Azure Vortexes

9252.desc: The Dragon Palace grants your fleet supporting fire in battle as well as protective shields.
9252.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - Azure Vortexes

9271.desc: The Dragon Palace grants the enemy supporting fire in battle as well as sporadic healing.
9271.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - Verdant Gales

9272.desc: The Dragon Palace grants your fleet supporting fire in battle as well as sporadic healing.
9272.name: Dragon Palace's Boon - Verdant Gales

9391.desc: Purity has captured 0% of this sea area! Continue the battle and strengthen Purity!
9391.name: Control Acquisition

9392.desc: Purity has captured 25% of this sea area! Continue the battle and strengthen Purity!
9392.name: Control Acquisition

9393.desc: Purity has captured 50% of this sea area! Continue the battle and strengthen Purity!
9393.name: Control Acquisition

9394.desc: Purity has captured 75% of this sea area! Continue the battle and strengthen Purity!
9394.name: Control Acquisition

9395.desc: Purity has captured 100% of this sea area! Continue the battle and strengthen Purity!
9395.name: Control Acquisition

9401.desc: Mecha support gauge is full! During battle, your fleets will receive Mecha barrage support.
9401.name: Mecha Support

9421.desc: Mecha support gauge is full! During battle, your fleets will receive Mecha barrage support.
9421.name: Mecha Support

9441.desc: Mecha support gauge is full! During battle, your fleets will receive Mecha barrage support.
9441.name: Mecha Support

9461.desc: Kaiju support gauge is full! During battle, your fleets will receive Kaiju barrage support.
9461.name: Kaiju Support

9481.desc: Kaiju support gauge is full! During battle, your fleets will receive Kaiju barrage support.
9481.name: Kaiju Support

9500.desc: Due to a highly reactive Wisdom Cube, the entire fleet's DMG increases by 20%, but their DMG taken also increases by 20%.
9500.name: Wisdom Cube Reactivity

9502.desc: An ominous mist surrounds the battlefield. The Accuracy of all your ships is decreased by 5%.
9502.name: Heavy Mist

9505.desc: Enemy Air Squads will appear on this stage, and your fleets will take 10% more damage from Airstrikes.
9505.name: Iron Blood Aerial Support

9508.desc: Darkness shrouds the battlefield, making it impossible to check the composition of enemy fleets before battle.
9508.name: Endless Night

10011.desc: The DMG of your fleets' Airstrikes is increased by 20% and the DMG your fleets take from enemy aircraft is decreased by 10% (Flooding and Burn DMG are unaffected). Your fleets' Accuracy is increased by 10% and your Ambush encounter rate is decreased by 8%.
10011.name: Air Supremacy

10012.desc: The DMG of your fleets' Airstrikes is increased by 12% and the DMG your fleets take from enemy aircraft is decreased by 6% (Flooding and Burn DMG are unaffected). Your fleets' Accuracy is increased by 5% and your Ambush encounter rate is decreased by 5%.
10012.name: Air Superiority

10013.desc: The DMG of your fleets' Airstrikes is decreased by 6% and the DMG your fleets take from enemy aircraft is increased by 3% (Flooding and Burn DMG are unaffected).
10013.name: Air Parity

10014.desc: The DMG of your fleets' Airstrikes is decreased by 12% and the DMG your fleets take from enemy aircraft is increased by 6% (Flooding and Burn DMG are unaffected). Your fleets' Accuracy and EVA is decreased by 3%.
10014.name: Air Denial

10015.desc: The DMG of your fleets' Airstrikes is decreased by 20% and the DMG your fleets take from enemy aircraft is increased by 10% (Flooding and Burn DMG are unaffected). Your fleets' Accuracy and EVA is decreased by 8%.
10015.name: Air Incapability

10021.desc: Your fleet is in Fever Mode, and will restore 2% Max HP at the beginning of battle.
10021.name: Fever Mode

10031.desc: At the start of the battle, your ships heal for 2.0% of their max HP.
10031.name: Eyes on Me!

10032.desc: Your ships deal 5.0% more DMG to enemies.
10032.name: Eyes on Me!

10033.desc: Your ships take 5.0% less DMG from enemies.
10033.name: Eyes on Me!

200000.desc: Captain Alfredo's air armada provides supporting fire during battles.
200000.name: Air Armada Support

200003.desc: Captain Alfredo's air armada provides supporting fire during battles.
200003.name: Air Armada Support

200006.desc: Captain Alfredo's air armada provides supporting fire during battles.
200006.name: Air Armada Support

200009.desc: All your Sardegna Empire ships deal 20% more DMG and take 20% less DMG.
200009.name: Miniature Mirror Sea

200011.desc: Strike with all the fury of a storm. Your fleet's FP and AVI are increased by 10%.
200011.name: Ancient Might

200012.desc: Heed the call of the legion's horn. Your fleet's RLD is increased by 15%.
200012.name: Ancient Alacrity

200013.desc: Bathe in the sun's splendorous light. Your fleet regains 3% HP at the start of each battle.
200013.name: Ancient Splendor

200015.desc: The world's vastness spreads out before your eyes. Your fleet's EVA is increased by 10%.
200015.name: Ancient Conquest

200016.desc: Behold the turning tides of fate. The enemy takes constant DMG during battle.
200016.name: Ancient Justice

200019.desc: Turn your back on the dying of the light. Your Flagship starts with her first attack pre-loaded.
200019.name: Ancient Apostasy

200023.desc: Experiment Condition: you may be hit by air raids while moving on the map. The chance of this happening decreases the higher your recon value is.
200023.name: Air Raids

200024.desc: Experiment Condition: you may encounter ambushes while moving on the map. The chance of this happening decreases the higher your recon value is.
200024.name: Ambushes

200025.desc: Experiment Condition: some enemy fleets may pursue you on the map.
200025.name: Pursuits

200052.desc: Increases all stats of the shipgirls participating in this game in the event story by 3.0%.
200052.name: Violet Domain

200054.desc: Reduces the ACC of all ships other than CVs by 5.0%.
200054.name: Obscuring Fog

200057.desc: Increases the SPD of all ships by 5.0%.
200057.name: Vision for a New Path

200060.desc: Increases DMG taken by all ships by 5.0%.
200060.name: Image of a Solitary Future

200063.desc: Increases the FP and EVA of all BBs and BCs by 5.0%, but decreases the FP and EVA of all DDs by 5.0%.
200063.name: Fair Winds, Fair Fight

200067.desc: Increases the Spread Range of all BBs and BCs by 2, and increases their FP by 5.0%.
200067.name: Overbearing Ambitions

200070.desc: During battle, lightning bolts periodically strike the battlefield, dealing damage proportional to current HP to both allies and enemies within range.
200070.name: Thunder's Roar

200074.desc: During battle, all ships periodically restore a small amount of HP.
200074.name: Irreconcilable Promises

200078.desc: All ships take 3.0% less DMG. At regular intervals, all ships either gain a shield that can block a number of shells, or restore a small amount of HP.
200078.name: Guardian's Determination

200079.desc: Obtainable materials: Nameless Grass, Wing Plant, Blood Taun (Silent Sickle required).
200079.name: The Land of Beginnings

200080.desc: Obtainable materials: Lightning Ore, Star Fragment, Septrin (Golden Axe required).
200080.name: The Underworld Grove

200081.desc: Obtainable materials: Small Crystals, Burning Sand, Magma Powder (Blue Bomb Rod required).
200081.name: The Castle of Strife

200082.desc: Obtainable materials: Pourpremoule, Sardine, Lake Master (Divine Fishing Rod required).
200082.name: The Desolate Capital

200083.desc: Obtainable materials: Strange Crystal Ore, Strange Armor Plate, Strange Energy Core (Laser Cutter required).
200083.name: The Central Foundation

200084.desc: An improved tool for gathering grass and flowers. It's been modified to make gathering easier, and reaps everything as quietly and lightly as the wind.
200084.name: Silent Sickle

200085.desc: An improved tool for splitting firewood and cutting down trees for lumber. It's been modified for better balance and sharpness, making gathering easier than ever.
200085.name: Golden Axe

200086.desc: A stronger version of the Bomb Rod. The jewel at the tip is blue now, and it can destroy rocks and crystals more easily.
200086.name: Blue Bomb Rod

200087.desc: An improved Fishing Rod. Fish will no longer flee from it, and some will even be more attracted to it than usual.
200087.name: Divine Fishing Rod

200088.desc: A mechanical arm made by the Sirens. It has a crushing grip strength and an extremely powerful mining laser. It might be useful for gathering alchemy materials.
200088.name: Laser Cutter

200239.desc:
The Devil XV's drones are empowering your ships. 
Your fleet has 10.0% increased FP, TRP, and AVI.
200239.name: Autonomous Support Drones

200240.desc:
Something isn't right. 
Barrages will fire during battle which harm anything in their path, friend or foe.
200240.name: Category V Threat - Omens

200241.desc:
A dark threat looms over the horizon. 
Barrages will fire during battle which harm anything in their path, friend or foe.
200241.name: Category V Threat - Incursion

200242.desc:
The Tower has come to purge the system. 
All ships lose a portion of their max HP at regular intervals during battle.
200242.name: Reorigination System

200327.desc:
The Basilica's control device is inoperable. 
Barrages will appear during battle, inflicting damage to all targets in proportion to their max HP.
200327.name: Basilica Control Device - Inoperable

200330.desc:
The Basilica's control device is recovering. 
Barrages will appear during battle, inflicting damage to all enemies in proportion to their max HP.
200330.name: Basilica Control Device - Recovering

200333.desc:
The Basilica's control device is stable. 
Barrages will appear during battle, inflicting damage to all enemies in proportion to their max HP and recovering the HP of your ships.
200333.name: Basilica Control Device - Stable

200336.desc:
The Iris has answered your prayers. 
Your Iris Libre and Vichya Dominion ships gain 3.0% FP, TRP, AVI, AA, RLD, ACC, and EVA.
200336.name: The Blessed Faithful - Iris Orthodoxy

200338.desc:
Your prayers have been answered... but by whom?
Your Royal Navy ships gain 3.0% FP, TRP, AVI, AA, RLD, ACC, and EVA.
200338.name: The Blessed Faithful - Royal Navy

200392.desc: All enemy fleets in the area will pursue you.
200392.name: Hunter's Tactics

200394.desc:
Current Corrosion Level: 0
Corrosion Level increases by 1 every time any of your fleets completes a battle, up to a maximum of 5. During battle, DMG dealt and received by your fleets will be increased depending on Corrosion Level.
At maximum Corrosion Level, your ships will have reduced SPD and ACC.
Certain ships, such as META ships, will not receive the increased DMG taken, reduced SPD, and reduced ACC effects from Corrosion.
200394.name: Corrupted Space

200396.desc:
Current Corrosion Level: 1
Corrosion Level increases by 1 every time any of your fleets completes a battle, up to a maximum of 5. During battle, DMG dealt and received by your fleets will be increased depending on Corrosion Level.
At maximum Corrosion Level, your ships will have reduced SPD and ACC.
Certain ships, such as META ships, will not receive the increased DMG taken, reduced SPD, and reduced ACC effects from Corrosion.
200396.name: Corrupted Space

200401.desc:
Current Corrosion Level: 2
Corrosion Level increases by 1 every time any of your fleets completes a battle, up to a maximum of 5. During battle, DMG dealt and received by your fleets will be increased depending on Corrosion Level.
At maximum Corrosion Level, your ships will have reduced SPD and ACC.
Certain ships, such as META ships, will not receive the increased DMG taken, reduced SPD, and reduced ACC effects from Corrosion.
200401.name: Corrupted Space

200406.desc:
Current Corrosion Level: 3
Corrosion Level increases by 1 every time any of your fleets completes a battle, up to a maximum of 5. During battle, DMG dealt and received by your fleets will be increased depending on Corrosion Level.
At maximum Corrosion Level, your ships will have reduced SPD and ACC.
Certain ships, such as META ships, will not receive the increased DMG taken, reduced SPD, and reduced ACC effects from Corrosion.
200406.name: Corrupted Space

200411.desc:
Current Corrosion Level: 4
Corrosion Level increases by 1 every time any of your fleets completes a battle, up to a maximum of 5. During battle, DMG dealt and received by your fleets will be increased depending on Corrosion Level.
At maximum Corrosion Level, your ships will have reduced SPD and ACC.
Certain ships, such as META ships, will not receive the increased DMG taken, reduced SPD, and reduced ACC effects from Corrosion.
200411.name: Corrupted Space

200416.desc:
Current Corrosion Level: 5
Corrosion Level increases by 1 every time any of your fleets completes a battle, up to a maximum of 5. During battle, DMG dealt and received by your fleets will be increased depending on Corrosion Level.
At maximum Corrosion Level, your ships will have reduced SPD and ACC.
Certain ships, such as META ships, will not receive the increased DMG taken, reduced SPD, and reduced ACC effects from Corrosion.
200416.name: Corrupted Space

200432.desc:
Thanks to Vestal META's support, the maximum Corrosion Level of this zone has been reduced. Furthermore, your ships will periodically restore HP and gain improved stats while in battle.
Current Max Corrosion Level: 1
200432.name: Framework of Logic  Support

200433.desc:
Thanks to Vestal META's support, the maximum Corrosion Level of this zone has been reduced. Furthermore, your ships will periodically restore HP and gain improved stats while in battle.
Current Max Corrosion Level: 2
200433.name: Framework of Logic  Support

200434.desc:
Thanks to Vestal META's support, the maximum Corrosion Level of this zone has been reduced. Furthermore, your ships will periodically restore HP and gain improved stats while in battle.
Current Max Corrosion Level: 3
200434.name: Framework of Logic  Support

200535.desc: In battle, all ships in your fleet gain +1.0% to all stats for each additional faction present in that fleet beyond the first.
200535.name: Alliance Fleet

200536.desc:
A strange substance seems to permeate this entire world.
Certain enemies release a strange substance when defeated, restoring the HP of adjacent enemies while damaging your ships.
200536.name: Corrosive Aberration

200538.desc:
"Commander, behold my next move."
In battle, allied Tribunal mass-produced ships and Mechanicus Confessors will lay down supporting barrages.
200538.name: Tribunal's Support

200541.desc:
"Commander, behold my next move."
In battle, allied Tribunal mass-produced ships and Mechanicus Confessors will lay down supporting barrages.
200541.name: Tribunal's Support

200544.desc:
"The Kingdom of God will descend upon the land!"
All ships within the False God's Domain have reduced stats.
In battle, enemies will gain supporting barrages.
200544.name: False God's Domain I

200545.desc:
"Thgdom of  will descon th"
All ships within the False God's Domain have further reduced stats.
In battle, enemies will gain stronger supporting barrages.
200545.name: False God's Domain II

200546.desc:
""
All ships within the False God's Domain have significantly reduced stats.
In battle, enemies will gain significantly stronger supporting barrages.
200546.name: False God's Domain III

200583.desc:
The calamitous dark mist forms a terrifying foe. 
In battle, barrages which attack your ships appear at regular intervals.
200583.name: Encroaching Dark Mist

200585.desc:
The Watatsumi's protective seal is weakening the dark mist. 
In battle, shields spawn around your ships at regular intervals, negating damage equal to a portion of their max HP.
200585.name: Sacred Sakura's Protection

200589.desc:
Use the power of prayer to overcome adversity. 
In battle, barrages that support your ships appear at regular intervals.
200589.name: Estuary of Faith

200592.desc:
Use the power of prayer to overcome adversity. 
In battle, barrages that support your ships appear at regular intervals.
200592.name: Estuary of Faith

200595.desc:
Use the power of prayer to overcome adversity. 
In battle, barrages that support your ships appear at regular intervals.
200595.name: Estuary of Faith

200618.desc: The Great Royal Fortune sails forth! During battle, your fleet will receive supporting fire from the Great Royal Fortune.
200618.name: Legendary Flagship

200620.desc: The Great Royal Fortune sails forth! During battle, your fleet will receive supporting fire from the Great Royal Fortune.
200620.name: Legendary Flagship

200622.desc: The Great Royal Fortune sails forth! During battle, your fleet will receive supporting fire from the Great Royal Fortune.
200622.name: Legendary Flagship

200624.desc:
The battle continues amidst a raging storm. 
All Tempesta ships take 3.0% less DMG.
200624.name: Abnormal Weather - Storm

200627.desc:
The battle continues in the eye of the storm. 
All Tempesta ships deal 3.0% more DMG.
200627.name: Abnormal Weather - Eye of the Storm

200630.desc: During battle, Grimoire Terminal will support your fleet with missiles.
200630.name: Meteor Missiles

200633.desc: During battle, Grimoire Terminal will support your fleet with missiles.
200633.name: Meteor Missiles

200645.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under the enemy's control. The enemy gains supporting barrages during battle.
200645.name: Land Pulse Device - Yin

200646.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under the enemy's control. The enemy gains supporting barrages during battle.
200646.name: Land Pulse Device - Yang

200647.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under the enemy's control. The enemy gains supporting barrages during battle and barriers that decrease their DMG taken.
200647.name: Land Pulse Device - Flash

200648.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under the enemy's control. The enemy gains supporting barrages during battle and an HP recovery effect.
200648.name: Land Pulse Device - Ryou

200649.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under the enemy's control. The enemy gains supporting barrages during battle and inflicts a damage-over-time poison ailment to shipgirls they hit.
200649.name: Land Pulse Device - Ken

200655.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle.
200655.name: Land Pulse Device - Yin

200658.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle.
200658.name: Land Pulse Device - Yang

200661.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle and barriers that decrease its DMG taken.
200661.name: Land Pulse Device - Flash

200664.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle and an HP recovery effect.
200664.name: Land Pulse Device - Ryou

200667.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle.
200667.name: Land Pulse Device - Yin

200670.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle.
200670.name: Land Pulse Device - Yang

200673.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle and barriers that decrease its DMG taken.
200673.name: Land Pulse Device - Flash

200676.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle and an HP recovery effect.
200676.name: Land Pulse Device - Ryou

200679.desc: The Land Pulse Device is under your control. Your fleet gains supporting barrages during battle and inflicts a damage-over-time poison ailment to enemies it hits.
200679.name: Land Pulse Device - Ken

200732.desc: The mysterious enemy is jamming your systems. Your ships have 5.0% decreased ACC and EVA and take 5.0% more DMG.
200732.name: Hoverfleet's Coercion

200735.desc: The floating fleet is engaging in electronic warfare. All enemies have 5.0% decreased ACC and EVA and take 5.0% more DMG.
200735.name: Support from the Council

200770.desc: The freezing Antarctic environment decreases your fleet's SPD by 3 and EVA by 10.0%. During battle, blizzards appear that hurt both friend and foe.
200770.name: Antarctic Cold

200774.desc:
Coordination and cooperation between all the fleets has been made possible thanks to Helena META's tactical command network. 
During certain battles, your fleet receives supporting barrages from the Azur Lane Combined Fleet.
200774.name: Command Support - Helena META

200777.desc:
Coordination and cooperation between all the fleets has been made possible thanks to Helena META's tactical command network. 
During certain battles, your fleet receives supporting barrages from the Azur Lane Combined Fleet.
200777.name: Command Support - Helena META

200780.desc: Saratoga is providing support with her secret weapon. During battle, special airstrikes will aid your fleet.
200780.name: Experimental Bomber Support

200783.desc: Saratoga is providing support with her secret weapon. During battle, special airstrikes will aid your fleet.
200783.name: Experimental Bomber Support

200902.desc: It's Alizarin's time to shine! When the battle starts, the passionate music increases all your ships' FP, TRP, AVI, and RLD by 5.0% for 15s.
200902.name: Song of Alizarin

200903.desc: The spotlight shines on Cyanidin! When the battle starts, the lovely music deploys a barrier (lasts 15s) around every ship in your fleet, capable of negating up to 2.0% of each respective ship's max HP in DMG, and decreases your ships' DMG taken by 5.0% for 15s.
200903.name: Song of Cyanidin

200908.desc:
The battle will initiate in challenge mode if your Vanguard consists of only a single ship when the battle starts. This will increase the difficulty, but also increase the score you gain.

- Challenge Mode Details -
 Enemies deal significantly more DMG and any shields they deploy have infinite HP.
 The more time passes, the more their DMG dealt increases.
 The skills "Quick Takeoff" and "Fiercer When Cornered" are rendered ineffective.
200908.name: Challenge Mode

200925.desc:
Death's Bridge has been activated. 
During battle, Death's Bridge will launch supporting attacks against your fleet.
200925.name: Death's Bridge

200926.desc:
/*Mimic beasts/* split into smaller segments when destroyed, propping up their ranks. 

So-called */mimic beasts*/ have been sighted. What are these things?
200926.name: Mimic Entities

200928.desc:
The concept of death has been anchored to the foundation, giving form to the Martyrium. 
During battle, whenever a ship in your fleet sinks an enemy, all of her stats increase by 1.0% (can be stacked up to 5 times).
200928.name: Martyrium of Death

200930.desc:
The concept of death has blossomed, and the Martyrium extols its noble sacrifice. 
During battle, whenever a ship in your fleet sinks an enemy, all of her stats increase by 1.0% (can be stacked up to 5 times); when she has sunk 10 enemies, your fleet will receive a supporting barrage.
200930.name: Martyrium of Noble Sacrifice

200931.desc:
The battle will initiate in challenge mode if a ship in your fleet has the Enigmata "D" equipped when the battle starts. This will increase the difficulty, but also increase the score you gain.

- Challenge Mode Details -
 Enemies deal significantly more DMG. As time passes, the DMG taken by enemies gradually increases.
 The skills "Quick Takeoff" and "Fiercer When Cornered" are rendered ineffective.
200931.name: Challenge Mode
